intro: Pistolochia alpestris, commonly known as the alpine pistolpod, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant is known for its hardy nature. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
